Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as **Design** view in [!INCLUDE[vs_current_short](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control markup is parsed. A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface. When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the ListViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a list of items that are used to create a smart tag panel.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.SampleRowCount%2A> property returns the number of records that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control displays on the design surface.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, which indicates that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> to generate the design-time markup.
The methods of the ListViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods provide support for editable regions at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method is used by the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control at design time if the two required templates for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) are not defined. The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%29> method to create a placeholder that displays the type and the ID of the control, and additional instructions for the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are required for the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

Docs.summary: Prevents the control from updating when the data source schema is refreshed in the HTML designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnSchemaRefreshed method notifies control designer object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control that is bound to the associated data source that the fields in the schema have changed. When this method is called, it prevents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control from updating itself.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of records that the control displays on the design surface.
Docs.value: The number of records that the control displays on the design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SampleRowCount property always returns 21. This causes 21 records to be displayed in the design surface for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. An exception is if there is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to a value less than 21. In that case, the number of records to display is the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. The maximum number of records that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control will display on the designer surface is 21 records.
